thread.title: New Low Pressure area to form over Bay on Nov 22, to become Depresson and intensify further, TN to get heavy rains
thread.title_full: New Low Pressure area to form over Bay on Nov 22, to become Depresson and intensify further, TN to get heavy rains

author: Uniindia News Service
title: New Low Pressure area to form over Bay on Nov 22, to become Depresson and intensify further, TN to get heavy rains
text: States » SouthPosted at: Nov 20 2025 2:40PM New Low Pressure area to form over Bay on Nov 22, to become Depresson and intensify further, TN to get heavy rainsChennai, Nov 20 (UNI) Even as yesterday's Low Pressure (LP) Area over Lakshadweep and adjoining Maldives persisted, a new LP Area will form over the Bay on November 22, which would concentrate into a Depression and intensify further, promising more rains in North, Cauvery delta and southern districts of the state from tomorrow to November 26. Meanwhile, several south coastal districts received copious rains with Ayikudi in Tenkasidistrict recording a maxium of 11 cms of rainfall, followed by Ambasamudram and KannadalanAnicut (Tirunelveli district) 11 each, Oothu, Nalmukku (both Tirunelveli district) and Tenkasi 9 each, Karuppanadhi Dam (Tenkasi) and Kakkachi (Tirunelveli district) 8 each, Manjolai(Tirunelveli district) and Shencottah (Tenkasi dist) seven each during the last 24 hrs ending at 0830 hrs this morning.Met office today said rainfall occurred at isolated places over Tamil Nadu, at a few places over South Tamil Nadu and at isolated places over North Tamil Nadu.Light rains also occurred over Karaikal area, while dry weather prevailed over Puducherry.Yesterday’s Low Pressure Area over Lakshadweep and adjoining Maldives area now lay centred over Southeast Arabian Sea and adjoining Lakshadweep area today. The associated cyclonic circulation extends up to 4.5 km abovemean sea level. It is likely to move slowly west northwestwards during the next 24 hours.As an Upper Air Cyclonic Circulation lies over central parts of Strait of Malacca andextended upto 5.8 km above mean sea level, it said under its influence, a fresh Low Pressure Area is likely to form over Southeast Bay of Bengal around November 22.It is very likely to move west-northwestwards and intensify into a Depression over central parts of South Bay of Bengal around November 24. Thereafter, it is very likely to continue to move west-northwestwards and intensify further over Southwest Bay of Bengal during the subsequent 48 hours.Meanwhile, yesterday’s Cyclonic Circulation over Southwest Bay of Bengal and neighbourhoodhas become less marked.Heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over Tenkasi, Virudhunagar, Tirunelveli, Kanyakumari, Thoothukudi, Ramanathapuram, Cuddalore, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam and Mayiladuthurai districts and Karaikal area tomorrow.On November 22 when the fresh LP area forms over the Bay, light to moderate rain is likely to occur at many places over Coastal Tamil Nadu, at isolated places over Interior Tamil Nadu and over Puducherry and Karaikal area with thunderstorm and lightning at one or two places.Heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over South coastal Ramanathapuram, Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli, Kanyakumari districts, Cauvery delta districts of Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai, Pudukkottai, South Interior Sivaganga and Northern Cuddalore districts of Tamil Nadu and Karaikal area in Puducherry.These districts will continue to receive heavy rains till November 24, while heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over Pudukkottai, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai, Cuddalore and Villuppuram districts of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry and Karaikal area the next day.On November 26, heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai, Cuddalore, and Villuppuram districts of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry and Karaikal area.It said squally weather with wind speed reaching 40 kmph to 50 kmph and gusting up to60 kmph is likely to prevail along and off Tamil Nadu coast, over Gulf of Mannar and Comorin area on November 24.Fishermen are advised not to venture into the above sea areas on that day. The forecast for Chennai city and its neighbourhood is the sky conditions would be partly cloudy with one or two spells of moderate rain accompanied by thunderstorm and lightning likely to occur.UNI GV 1435Tags:
